profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 07:36

did.unittitle: Yale Peabody Museum Archives

repository.corpname: Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History

did.abstract: Archives of the Yale Peabody Museum of Natural History.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Yale Peabody Museum Archives, Archives, Yale Peabody Museum

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: The Peabody Museum of Natural History at Yale University has an extensive and rich archive of materials related not only to the history of the Museum, the individuals involved in its founding, and the early days of its collections, but also to the early history of higher education in the natural sciences in the United States, especially in paleontology. Much of the Yale Peabody Museum's exceptional collections of over 12 million specimens and objects in anthropology, zoology, paleontology, entomology, ornithology, geology, mineralogy, meteorites and historical scientific instruments have been photographically documented.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Material
scopecontent.p: The archives of the Yale Peabody Museum contain material relating to the founding and history of the Museum as well as the archives various faculty, staff and affiliates.

did.unittitle: George Wieland archives

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material pertaining to George Wieland including field notebooks, ledgers, correspondence, and photographs

did.unittitle: Notebooks.
Field notebook.
Field notebook.
Notebook. Record of photomicrographs, new series.
Notebook. University of Wyoming, USN, and Colorado cycad section list
Notebook. Cycadeoidea trunk list. Copied by T. A. Bostwick. Black Hills list plus.
Notebook. Notes on the Fossil Cycads of the Yale Museum, George Wieland. Includes list of Yale types.
Notebook. Cycadeoid and other, Trial and type sections, all. Cut by Wieland beginning December 1, 1898.
Photographs and sketches.
Photograph. Wieland with Ross R. Wolfe posing behind three fossil cycadeoids in Stephenville, TX.
Photograph. Wieland at Turtle Horizon, Cycad Monument
Photograph. Wieland in Field. ProbablyTurtle Horizon, Cycad Monument.
Photograph. Marties(?) Hill from Cycad Monument
Photograph. Wieland in his home next to fireplace.
Photograph. Wieland in the field
Photograph. Wieland at excavation site with field crew.
Photograph. Wieland in the field. Probably at Turtle Horizon, Cycad Monument.
Photograph. Wieland in the field. Probably at Turtle Horizon, Cycad Monument.
Photograph. Wieland pointing out view of north boundary of Fossil Cycad National Monument
Photograph. Portrait of George R. Wieland.
Photograph. Wieland posing with mounted Archelon skeleton.
Photograph. Sketch of cycadeoid.
Photograph. Images of male and female cycadeoid.
Photograph. Wieland posing with group of women around a fossil cycadeoid.
Photograph. Wieland posing with faculty members from John Tarleton College: Prof. Scott, Hugh M. Smith, Ross R. Wolfe, and Davis in from on three fossil cycadeoids.
Photograph. Three fossil cycadeoids.
Photograph. Three fossil cycadeoids.
Photograph. Wieland in the field. L. South West. Exc.A.1
Photograph. Looking South East over C. superba excavation (above faulting)
Photograph. Looking North east. Quarry III, V, VI. Quarry I in foreground.
Photograph. Looking West. Quarry VI, V, III.
Photograph. Wieland in the field with fossil cycadeoid.
Photograph. Fossil cycadeoid next to modern cycads in garden.
Photograph. Looking east. Quarries V, VI.
Sketch. Diagramatic sketch of Cycadeoidea dacotensis. Includes images of front and back side of paper.
Sketch. Cross section of cycadeoid with number and letter labels.

Miscellaneous photographs, slides, sketches and other material.
Age of Reptiles Mural in process. Black and white photograph of Rudolph Zallinger working on Age or Reptiles mural.
Art supplies. Pigments, sage brushes, casein, and pallette of Zallinger, used for the Age of Mammals mural.
Book. "An Account of the Meteor" Memoirs of the Connecticut Academy of Arts and Sciences, 1810, Authors: Benjamin Silliman and James L. Kingsley.
Brontosaur with Lull and Gibb. Black and white photograph of Lull and Gibb with mounted Brotosaurus in Peabody Museum Great Hall.

Exhibition Hall Guide. General Guide to the Exhibition Halls of the Peabody Museum.
Foucault Pendulum. Black and white image of Foucault Pendulum in Peabody Museum lobby.

Great Hall 1924. Black and white image of Peabody Museum Great Hall, 1924.

Gregory Gargantua. Black and white photograph of Gregory holding skull of Gargantua.

Horse Case Postcard. Black and white postcard of Evolution of Horses exhibit case in Peabody Museum.
